=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
This game is essentially an arcade-style space shooter where you control a spaceship (the avatar) in a battle against waves of alien enemies. Here’s a breakdown:

• Genre and Theme: 
 – A classic shooter set in space. You pilot a spaceship against incoming aliens, dodging enemy fire and launching your own projectiles.

• Main Sprites and Their Roles:
 – The Avatar: Your spaceship (the FlakAvatar) you control. It can fire a blue “sam” bullet upward.
 – The Missiles and Sam Bullets: Your projectiles. They travel upward (or in given directions) to take out enemy threats.
 – The Aliens: Enemy spacecraft (some of which look like alienBlue or alienGreen). They have bombing capabilities (dropping red bombs) that come down toward the base.
 – Bombs: Enemy projectiles that fall downward. Contact with them is dangerous.
 – The Base: A white planet that stays in one place and acts like a safe “object” for some interactions. Enemies colliding with the base are usually killed—but bombs hitting it can destroy both.
 – Portals (portalSlow and portalFast): Invisible spawn points that intermittently produce aliens. They are the source of your enemy waves.

• Game Mechanics:
 – Movement: Your avatar flies about on the screen (with an interaction that makes it “stepBack” at the screen’s edge) while aliens patrol their areas (turning around when reaching the end of screen).
 – Shooting: You fire blue “sam” bullets (and possibly also missiles) to destroy enemies. When your projectile hits an enemy alien, it awards you points.
 – Collisions have different effects. For example, if an alien is hit by your bullet, it’s removed and you get bonus points; however, colliding with an alien or enemy bomb directly costs you points.
 – The base interacts with incoming projectiles and enemies as well. Some collisions (like the base getting hit by a sam bullet) give you a small score bonus even as the involved sprites are removed from play.

• Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 – You lose if your avatar is destroyed (the game checks if you have 0 avatars).
 – You win by eliminating all enemy aliens and stopping further spawns (the game ends in your favor when all aliens and their portals have been removed).

• Overall Strategy:
 1. Keep Your Ship Alive: Your single (or limited) avatar is key. Avoid collisions with aliens and enemy bombs because any contact not only can cost points but may directly end the game.
 2. Prioritize Enemies and Dodging: Focus on shooting down the aliens before they can drop bombs or cause further chaos. Watch for the movement pattern—enemies change direction when they hit screen bounds—and adjust your positioning accordingly.
 3. Timing and Accuracy: Use your “sam” bullets wisely. They not only destroy aliens for extra points but also, if used carefully, can trigger favorable interactions. Be mindful not to accidentally hit the base with your shots if that isn’t your intention.
 4. Maintain the Base’s Safety: The base acts as a kind of ally by killing aliens on contact. However, if it gets hit by a bomb it is destroyed along with the bomb. So, hover near your base to benefit from its defensive capabilities while ensuring it isn’t overwhelmed by enemy fire.
 5. Manage the Spawn Points: Since the portals periodically release enemies, clear the aliens coming from these portals quickly. Eliminating both the aliens and their portals leads to victory.

In summary, your overall strategy should be to navigate and shoot with precision while dodging enemy fire, protect your base as a defensive asset, and systematically eliminate both the aliens and the sources that spawn them. This measured, careful approach helps you rack up points and ultimately win the game by clearing the screen of hostile entities.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
